comments:
Received the following sqlException when displaying L1:Computers view 

org.apache.derby.client.am.SqlException: Column 'ENTITY_TO_PORT.ZONE_ID' is either not in any table in the FROM list or appears within a join specification and is outside the scope of the join specification or appears in a HAVING clause and is not in the GROUP BY list. If this is a CREATE or ALTER TABLE  statement then 'ENTITY_TO_PORT.ZONE_ID' is not a column in the target table.
	at org.apache.derby.client.am.Statement.completeSqlca(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.derby.client.net.NetStatementReply.parsePrepareError(Unknown Source)

	at org.apache.derby.client.am.PreparedStatement.prepare(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.derby.client.am.Connection.prepareStatementX(Unknown Source)

	at org.eclipse.aperi.server.guireq.topology.views.ViewerSanL1.getZonesFromEntitiesConnectedToEntity(ViewerSanL1.java:1401)

The DB zip file to recreate the Topo View is in bvrgsa.ibm.com\projects\a\defects\170024
Checked in a fix.. will test it in tomorrow's build to see if it is fixed. Seems to be a query that did not keep up with the db changes.
The problem had been fixed by the build of Aperi-20070109-212026.zip

traces.message: Column 'ENTITY_TO_PORT.ZONE_ID' is either not in any table in the FROM list or appears within a join specification and is outside the scope of the join specification or appears in a HAVING clause and is not in the GROUP BY list.
